title: Apple harvests record iPhone output from its India orchard
description: Apple significantly ramped up iPhone production and exports from India in the first half of 2025, driven by diversification efforts and potential US tariffs on Chinese imports. iPhone production surged by 53%, with exports reaching $22.56 billion. Foxconn and…

title: Apple's first foldable iPhone tipped to feature 7.8-inch display, A20 Pro chip, and 48MP cameras
description: According to tipster @Jukanlosreve, the iPhone Fold will feature a 7.8-inch inner display and a 5.5-inch cover display. It will reportedly be powered by Apple's A20 Pro chipset, built on TSMC's 2nm process. Other rumored specifications include 12GB of RAM and…

title: Next two years are crucial for India’s semicon plans: Ashok Chandak, President of SEMI India and IESA
description: IESA is working on a supply chain management plan to address the issue of access to raw materials such as silicon wafers, says Ashok Chandak

title: Next two years are crucial for India’s semicon plans: Ashok Chandak, President of SEMI India and IESA
description: Access to critical components like silicon wafers is a challenge for India's semiconductor industry, but solutions are being pursued.

title: Meta doubled down on AI infrastructure, Foxconn, Taiwan supply chain ride the cocktail
description: Meta is turbocharging its bet on artificial intelligence, with CEO Mark Zuckerberg revealing plans to invest hundreds of billions of dollars in building large-scale AI infrastructure. However, not everyone sees the endless potential of the area, with some mar…

title: Nissan to close two plants in Japan; ongoing talks with Foxconn for future transformation
description: Nissan announced on July 15, 2025, that its Oppama plant will cease production by the end of fiscal year 2027. Vehicle manufacturing operations will be transferred to Nissan Motor Kyushu located in Fukuoka Prefecture. Subsidiary Nissan Shatai's Shonan plant i…

title: Skidding Nissan to halt production at Oppama plant in Kanagawa Prefecture
description: Struggling auto giant Nissan said Tuesday it will stop production at its plant at Oppama in Yokosuka, Kanagawa Prefecture, at the end of its 2027 fiscal year. Nissan posted a net loss of 671 billion yen last year and it has said it will cut 15 percent of its …

title: iPhone Fold could be cheaper than expected
description: Apple’s first foldable iPhone could be cheaper than initially expected, but not by much. The company is said to save some money on the SoC, cameras, and memory which would theoretically bring the final MSRP down, a bit.

title: iPhone Fold is coming: Five new features for next year's launch
description: Apple's been oddly quiet about foldables while Samsung, Google, and even OnePlus have been folding screens left and right. But here's the kicker: Apple is reportedly working on two foldable products, and the iPhone Fold is coming first. According to Ming-Chi …

title: Foldable iPhone in 2026? Apple’s game-changer may launch at $1,800 with limited stock
description: Apple is set to launch its first foldable iPhone, dubbed the 'iPhone Fold,' in the latter half of 2026. This move could revitalize the foldable market, benefiting suppliers like Samsung and Foxconn. Analysts estimate the price between $1,800 and $2,000, with …

title: Nissan to end production at one of Japan’s first large-scale car plants

title: Nissan to end production at Japan’s Oppama factory by March 2028
description: Nissan Motor Co. plans to cease vehicle production at its Oppama plant in Japan by March 2028, shifting operations to Nissan Motor Kyushu as part of a global restructuring. The Shonan factory will also halt production by March 2027. CEO Ivan Espinosa aims to …
